website_summaries.verdict: This 3-hole punch has a nice design and is also sturdier than you'd expect.
pros: The center hole on this punch is adjustable
A little sturdier than other hole punches
A good product for light home use
Punches through all the sheets without skipping
cons: This model is made for punching only up to 10 sheets at a time, which is slightly less than others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This hole punch works amazingly. I punch holes in about 10 pages at once. It always makes the holes without skipping any pages and it is easy to empty the little paper circles out of. Sleek design and easy to store away. Good hole punch! If the review helped at all please let me know. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: phillygrl

customer_reviews.title: Quality item.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Swingline Desktop Hole Punch to set up my home office during this COVID19 pandemic. It was just what I was hoping for. I wanted to have the capability of making 3 & 2 holes in the paper without having to own and have room for two separate pieces of equipment and this hole punch does that well. It is not quite as effortless as I would like though. I have to use a flathead screwdriver to move the hole punching prongs to make the adjustment from three to two holes but since I don't have to do that too often for my purposes this was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hole punch!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The adjustable hole punches comes in handy a lot. I can adjust it so it fits my mini binder or if I need to adjust to fit a binder that's just a little longer than regular hole punches. I really like that it catchs the little holes so I don't have to stand over a trash can. Easy bottom removal for quick paper clean up. Cons: with thicker papers it has a harder time punching through, but I feel like that's any hole punch, 10 regular papers is a little to thick and hard to punch through. Overall great hole punch and does the job. 4 stars becasue it has a hard time punchs through 10 pages.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Broke In Just Over One Month
customer_reviews.text: I purposely bought this Swingline hole punch due to the quality of their products, however in just over a month of use, it broke. One of the hole punch pins and metal washers popped out unexpectedly and were impossible to reinsert. I had to throw it away as it was just over the return period. I had not over burdened the punch by loading excessive sheets or using excessive force so I'm not sure what could have happened to make the pin come out. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy v.

customer_reviews.title: That didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the end of August. I didn't need it until last week (10/17). I opened the box, and hole punched about 8 sheets of paper. It got stuck, and when I pushed the handle, trying to get it to release the pages, it shot a little metal piece across the room. It no longer works, as one of the punchers is now permanently stuck shut. Of course, I didn't need to use this until after the return date has passed. 8 sheets for almost $8....what a deal. 10/10 do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: It's still punching away :)
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I bought this to help keep my kid's virtual learning supplies and assignments organized. I chose to punch holes in everything...and put it all in designated binders. It punches well, seems sturdy and oooweeee, it helped this unorganized mama snap into shape to be able to keep everything straight while homeschooling 3 kids during the Pandemic. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B.

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 5 minites of being out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I received the package this morning. Took it out if the package and sat down to start hole punching my kid's school work. Second stack of papers (6 sheets, I counted) and the middle punch got stuck. Had to take the back off and use a pen to shove it back out. I did several "test" punches without paper to see what the problem was, assuming it was user error. Nope. The spring on the middle punch is broken, so it doesn't retract. I'm disappointed because it was a great price, had great reviews, and is a recognizable brand. I'll be returning this immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with paper larger than 11" in length
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a well built piece, but it's made in such a way that there is absolutely no way to use it with paper larger than 11" in length. The punches are back between the metal side supports, which are spaced exactly 11" apart. I had intended to use this to punch laminated recipe pages, but the lamination makes the page too big to fit (lamination pouches are about 11.5" in length). Rather than hassle with returning something at this price point I think I'll just be using a rotary tool to cut a slot in one of the supports to allow the pages to pass through. There's plenty of "meat" in the supports that it shouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Home School/Work From Home
customer_reviews.text: There are some office supplies you don't realize you use as often as you do, until they are unavailable. Working from home/home schooling now i've realized the benefits of many shared office supplies that I just had at my disposal when IN the office. I've slowly had to buy pens, tape, stapler, mouse pad etc. and now a 3 ring punch! I'd been hesitant to buy one, either they were super cheap, and looked super cheap, or silly expensive. Got this one on a flash deal, and its beautiful! ha! It's sturdy, heavy duty and exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Carlyle

customer_reviews.title: Good hole punch, bad packaging...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight, easy to use, works well. Cons: Holy crap nugget, that packaging though. Some other reviewers had mentioned the green thing that says "remove" was too tight, and not easy to remove. This was my experience as well. I had to wait for my husband to get home from work, and he needed to use pliers. I am not even joking- it BROKE our pliers. My husband was finally able to wiggle it loose by pressing down really hard on the back of the hole punch (as if he were using it) while pulling on the plastic piece. My thought is it has to have gotten jostled and jammed in somehow during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Wever household

customer_reviews.title: Will not punch papers longer than about 11.25"
customer_reviews.text: So far, this punch has worked well. I bought it to punch laminated pages and it cuts through single laminated pages easily. However, laminating an 8.5 x 11" page makes the page larger unless you take the extra step of cutting it back down. Since I have hundreds to punch, I do not want to take this extra step. The punch has a size limit of about 11.25" long/wide. I wish it were a quarter inch longer! Unfortunately, the length limit is not changeable - it's part of the metal part of the punch. So, if you're buying it thinking you can punch longer pieces of paper, beware.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Middle punch broke after one week
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine with about 10 or so pages but then the middle punch broke stuck down so you can't get the pages out without taking off the bottom and pushing the post back up to get the pages out. Now, every time you use it the post stays stuck down unless you take off the bottom and push the post back up again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gillar

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: It works well, but the only thing I dislike it that the the holes made are always fairly close to the border of the paper so if you’re off by a little bit you’re going to just make half a circle with the border. There’s no way to adjust that. Since it’s so close to the edge, the paper is more likely to rip from a three ring binder with even the slightest pull
customer_reviews.author: nestor

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I needed a basic hole punch and ended up purchasing this one because it's relatively the same price as the cheesy ones on here. This seems quite sturdy and doesn't "stick" to the paper after I hole punch something, which always happened with my old cheap one. Definitely pleased with the quality of this and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Extra punch?
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item, so I do not know about its durability. From appearance and test use it appears to be fine for the use I have planned. My one caution would be that the ad mentions an extra punch, and some reviewers talked about having to replace a defective punch with the extra one. My punches appear to work fine. However, there was no extra punch in the box. I do not know if the mistake is in the ad or in the packaging, but I was surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: Great price✅ Great brand✅ Punched holes in stuff✅
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! It just arrived today, and I hole-punched the 120-page training I have to give, and it was a breeze. I see that others have had issues with the punches sticking, but I haven’t run into that yet, and the confetti all stayed in its little compartment while I was using it. If I experience issues in the future, I’ll update this, but it’s sturdier than my old one and, especially for my arthritic (PsA) joints, fairly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.
customer_reviews.text: This hole punch seems well built, but the holes are punched very close to the edge of the paper and there is no way to adjust that. When turning pages back and forth in a binder, the holes will easily be torn through and the pages will come out. I'm glad I didn't spend much money on it
customer_reviews.author: Lotus Flower

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Lasts forever. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a Swingline! In my experience this brand lasts forever. I needed a three hole punch at my home office so I chose this one. I was surprised at how inexpensive it was. The Swingline three hole punch that I inherited at the business I bought 29 years prior was still going strong when I sold the business after the 29 years. So they inherited it. This one is nicer with the rubber padding that isn’t so hard on your hands. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: The security tab won't cone off for nothing and I missed my return window. It's defective and I can't use it. Be warned you may receive a defective one too. Hopefully the seller will give me a refund so I can update this awful review.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: accepts paper 11-1/4 inch or shorter
customer_reviews.text: The listing needs to state the size of the opening that you put the paper into. It is 11-1/4 inches which is the size of a standard piece of computer paper. The manila folders I needed it for are standard 11-3/4 inches and won't fit into the opening. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Lee

customer_reviews.title: Lovely item
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely item that punches not one, not two, but three holes in your paper/document. This is particularly handy if you have a three ring binder, one hole for each ring. This thing also does a nice job catching the little paper circles too so you can save them until you have a nice, confetti-size bunch and then surprise someone with your paper circle confetti.
customer_reviews.author: modus77

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: This hole puncher will not accept paper longer than 8 1/2 x 11 (letter size). There was nothing in the description explaining its limited use. Since my work involves using legal size (8 1/2 x 14) pages, this device is practically worthless. Thanks for ripping me off, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: DWGG

customer_reviews.title: Not adjustable!!
customer_reviews.text: Even though it says it’s adjustable it really isn’t! You can go from 3 holes down to 2 (with some unscrewing) but you cannot adjust the length of the paper by a little. It will punch through laminate but the BIG problem is that when a printer sheet is laminated it’s length is increased slightly causing it to too long to fit it the hole punch. And there is no way to adjust it slightly. Big bummer had to return and look for something else. I wish it was more clearly specified.
customer_reviews.author: P. Shah

customer_reviews.title: Skip this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product, because I’m in college and have lots of notes and papers. After not even using this whole punch for the second time, something flung off on one of the punching mechanisms, and wouldn’t release my papers. Now they want me to go through the effort of sending it back, before they’ll issue me refund. The frustrating thing is I ordered this off of amazon fresh because I needed it ASAP, and it broke 5 papers in. So cheaply made, I’d recommend finding another one.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: It was on sale and the price is acceptable. When I received the actual product, I was surprised with the quality. It is made with solid plastic and heavy metal with good quality. It can be adjusted to use as a two or three holes puncher. The capacity can be up to ten pages. It seems to be heavy duty and will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. KEEP LOOKING. This hole puncher broke within the first five minutes of using. Unreal. I was punching about 5 sheets at a time and on about the fifth try, two metal pieces (Maybe a washer of some sort) broke off and went flying resulting in one of the three springs seizing and locking all of my important papers within it. It took my husband about 20 minutes to completely dismantle the puncher with screwdriver, pliers and scissors to free the paper. Sadly, this is just another piece of Chinese garbage headed to the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: P'sMom

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Home Office Tool [Revised]
customer_reviews.text: In my original post, I had some issues... After 7 months of use, I am happy to report that my hole punch delivers a clean cut throughout. The only issue I have is with the catchment: it isn't closed so paper cutouts easily spill when I move the item. It's a slick looking, handy, sturdy item that will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: DeoMor

customer_reviews.title: A great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of this hole punch for the price. I done exactly what I was hoping that it was able to do, I really don't understand how it got any negative reviews because it worked great for me. I would definitely buy it again but I can't imagine having to do so as I a very sturdy hole punch. A+++
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap hole puncher so it works well for the price! I've used better swingline hole punchers where it's so easy to press but those are closer to the $15-$20 range. For under $10, this does the job. I've hole punched some papers already that need to go in binders and no complaints so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and works well. Had a little trouble the first time I tried to empty it that caused a bit of confetti to scatter but since then I haven't had any issues emptying it. It doesn't punch as many pages at the same time as I had hoped but it is easy to line pages up when using it so that the hole placement on longer documents is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Em F

customer_reviews.title: Broke twice on first day
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first day I had it. One of the pegs that punch down got stuck after punching. Had to take it apart and readjust the spring while my papers were still in it. After punching for a while just fine it got stuck down again. When I tried to take it apart to fix it the peg fell all the way out and is extremely complicated to put back together. Would not buy another one, extremely irritated it wouldn't last an hour, let alone a single day.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Broke.
customer_reviews.text: It's too late for me to return this which is disappointing. Using this in a regular manner (not stuffing papers in it or every day, several times a day) it became a TWO hole puncher in 3 months time. Two of the metal pieces in one of the holes came out and while I tried, it can't be repaired. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Mom23

customer_reviews.title: The plastic piece that catches the punched holes comes off easily. Makes a big mess!
customer_reviews.text: The bottom plastic piece that catches the holes that were punched in paper comes off very easily when you pick it up/move it. Then you have to clean up a mess all over your floor or where you used it.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: I mean, it's Swingline.
customer_reviews.text: Love swingline, it's one of those reliable brands. Keep in mind that this will only punch through very few pages, even if you tried to fit a few extra pages it just simply wont fit. I would recommend only for small projects or if your just keeping records of bills/receipts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Punch holes!
customer_reviews.text: Now I punch holes in paper like a crime fighter. Just it cannot handle large stacks of paper, so I am limited super hero of hole-punching. Maybe at max, it held like 20 papers together. Like some Boy Wonder of limited punching abilities. If we were rich we could afford to be Batman. But we are poor circus folk that scrape peanuts for this $8 hole puncher. Damnit Batman.
customer_reviews.author: Eggs N Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Have to keep unjamming it
customer_reviews.text: Works well but I keep having to unjam it... Doesn't Jam up on me if remove the back cover but then of course it makes a mess. I'm homeschooling so I use it more than most might not be a big issue for someone who's not punching hundreds of pieces of paper
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Flanigan

customer_reviews.title: Would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I needed a whole puncher for Distance Learning. This one was on promotion. Easy choice. It’s a nice size, not huge like whole punchers of the past. It doesn’t take a ton of space on a desk. It works well and could be adjusted to punch smaller papers. Happy purchase
customer_reviews.author: Enagda

customer_reviews.title: Dependable puncher
customer_reviews.text: This is the hole punch we grew up with in high school. Better than the arm-vwraion, which has a tendency to slide off the press bar, leaving me on my rump or face planting. Punches about 8-10 standard papers. Captures the confetti for NY Eve. Good hole punch.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for All papers!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my son's distance learning papers from school or worksheet printout and keep a binder of all his subjects. This hole-puncher is very handy and easy to use as well. Punches about 4-6 loose leaf paper and 3-5 pcs of regular copy printer paper.
customer_reviews.author: AdalynRose

customer_reviews.title: Broke just outside the 30 day return window
customer_reviews.text: It broke just outside the 30 day return window, so I can't return it. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: M. LANZ

customer_reviews.title: It works, but I wish the slot was wider.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great hole punch, although I wish the opening was wider. A laminated standard piece of paper wouldn't fit correctly in the slot of the hole punch. I found myself having to force the laminated sheet into the spot, bending the corners of the sheet. Eh. Still works tho.
customer_reviews.author: Crawdaddy

customer_reviews.title: There IS an alignment stopper
customer_reviews.text: I was scared that when I purchased this there wouldn’t be an alignment stopper based on the reviews I read, but there is! I’m so happy that I can now organize all my important papers and put them together instead of stuffed in different folders. I added a photo with the hole puncher besides a pair of normal sized kitchen scissors for size comparison. The only CON for this is that the top two holes don’t release the paper into the plastic part so when I go to throw out the “confetti” it makes from hole punching, I have to grab a small paper clip and get them out manually. Other than that, great value.
customer_reviews.author: Talon

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the item it was rusted and could not adjust to make 3 hole puncher because it was broke. My husband says that it is a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: tally

customer_reviews.title: Broke after light usage.  Possibly defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a short while, until a retaining clip came out of one of the three punch mechanisms. I attempted to repair it but lack the proper tools. Anyway, the retaining clip appears to be bent, and would not stay in place, even if I could insert it properly. It's likely the item was defective originally, as I don't think this steel clip could have been bent by the very light use the unit was subjected to. I'll give it two stars assuming this was a manufacturing defect. Defects do occur occasionally, especially for companies who adhere to 2 sigma manufacturing standards.
customer_reviews.author: TreeDoctor

customer_reviews.title: Not AS adjustable as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: This type of hole punch rarely seems to line up quite as well as I wish it did. It's a shame that this one's no different. It's adjustable to certain pre-set positions, but there's no fine control when the holes don't match up quite right.
customer_reviews.author: JackOfAllGames

customer_reviews.title: Don’t jam the thing! Store in cool dry places.
customer_reviews.text: A great buy! Just don’t overload the thing and try to hole punch a thick stack of papers y’all. It will last you a few good years if you take care of the thing. Humidity will eat away at the springs if you’re not too careful storing it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Came missing a piece
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be missing a part. It only makes two holes instead of three. It didn’t come with any extra pieces either. I want a replacement or refund but it’s such a hassle to have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Kush

customer_reviews.title: I also got a faulty one with the middle punch ...
customer_reviews.text: I also got a faulty one with the middle punch hole not working. It's extremely frustrating and I'm way past the window to return. Going to have to find a different one, as this product is not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Rie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even the 2nd time
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why these are cheap. They are if better quality than other, more expensive hole punchers. The punches themselves have stayed sharp forever. I bought this specific puncher since my son stole the exact same brand and model I had before. You can also adjust the space between the holes with a small screwdriver. If the rubber piece that fits over the bottom stretches out, dip it in boiling water, thats cooled a few seconds and mold back around the bottom of the hole puncher. Make sure to use a hot pad so you don't burn your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lorin Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good, thanks.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a pain adjusting the punches and it should also have adjustable paper guide on the side. Without the guide, you have to measure and hold the paper in the right spot when punching other than normal page size.
customer_reviews.author: Grizz

customer_reviews.title: Alright product..
customer_reviews.text: I disliked this product because i recieved a used one. It does work as it should. Just disappointed in not being new. The box was torn and the product itself had scratches and some wear and tear on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for my needs and was half the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works well with printer paper or typing paper. Not sure what the screws are made of but hopefully they hold up well. First few pages up punched did have some black residue left behind. Price was half the big box office supply wanted for the identical hole punch.
customer_reviews.author: Darcomg

customer_reviews.title: Daddy is happy. ... :-)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wonderful 85 year old daddy. He is always keeping notes and paperwork for his church, but I saw him struggling with a hole puncher that only did one hole at a time. With one crippled hand from birth, it was pretty hard. Plus, he was constantly having to line up holes one at a time. When I got this for him, he thought it was like Christmas :-) we loved how it was sturdy, accurate, sharp enough to do 10 sheets at a time, 3 perfectly placed holes each time, comfort push down top, and doesn't slip around. I would absolutely recommend this to people.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great, like it
customer_reviews.text: I tend to buy the cheapest product with good reviews that I can find, and that’s what I did here... completely happy with it, the reviews were spot on this time. It’s nice looking, sturdy, works well.
customer_reviews.author: Arjasy

customer_reviews.title: It broke after two uses
customer_reviews.text: It broke and when I tried to fix it, I saw that there was a metal spring missing from the third hole-punch. I didn't use it until after the return date, so now I'm stuck with a broken hole-puncher :(
customer_reviews.author: Ariella

customer_reviews.title: Needs some maintence to get the best result
customer_reviews.text: The hole punch came with some small metal debris sticking on the punching units. Not sure if the unit was abused and returned or just like that out of the factory. I cleaned them up before using to prevent further damage.
customer_reviews.author: RAY5D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for a relatively compact 3-hole punch
customer_reviews.text: I don't plan on adjusting my three-hole punch, so I'm not too frustrated with the difficulty in adjusting the widths of the punches. But for standard 3-ring binder work, these are great. I bought two. Just make sure not to overload it with too many pages or it'll get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this hole punch to use at home. The Swingline desktop hole punch can be used for 2 or 3 hole punching. It has a 10 sheet capacity, and a rubber tray on the bottom to catch the confetti. I was surprised at the quality and weight of this hole punch for the price. It worked really well, even when punching ten sheets at a time. I haven’t tried adjusting the holes, so can’t speak to how easy that is to do. It works well for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Yes. Just Yes.
customer_reviews.text: As a SLP I make materials, basically all day everyday. I was using a single hole puncher to put things in binders, which was killing me. Bought this and it works like a charm. Easy to use, came packaged well, and continues to work even though I use it constantly. Durable and efficient, and budget-friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Can handle 10 sheets
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't find my 3 hole punch, so I purchased this Swingline punch. Swingline is a old well known company, and you can see why, this is so well made. Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: TV

customer_reviews.title: The middle hole is not static!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! The holes are adjustable and I read that it made it hard to use because the guide is foe larger paper...I thought I would figure out a work around if needed.... however, I didnt need to! The guide works great for 5.5 x 8 paper. All you need to do is adjust the holes to use 1, 5, and 7 (counting from the end nearest the guide) and you can punch perfect holes for a mini binder! I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Shandy Copher

customer_reviews.title: It will last long enough to hand down to my grandchildren
customer_reviews.text: The hole puncher is hefty and well made. It will last longer than me. I got tired of trying my wife's hole puncher so I bought my own. It is right handy when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. John M. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Quality of build is terrible
customer_reviews.text: It's very cheap looking and feeling. It feels like it cost $.87 cents in China and is being sold for 1000% markup. It works dont get me wrong but I believe the "other" brand Bostoch that is similar priced would be a better option for the same price point. I will try that one next time. I assumed this one being "on sale" for half off would give me better quality than the other of similar price. However I was wrong and fell for the old ockey doke trick of marketing 101. Good move seller.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two, one for work and one for home. It is lightweight and easy to punch the holes. The holes are sharp and crisp. Does not take up much space to store when not in use. Rating 5 stars = Love It.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineMM

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a college student working online this semester and I have a lot of notes that my professor has us print up. This thing has been working like a boss.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Easy buy
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 4 years now and love it! I use it all the time at home for school papers. Easy to clean out the paper circles from the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got it to do what I needed for half sheet binder
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for half sheet 3 hole binder due to ability to adjust holes. However there are no markings like measuring tape to insure that the smaller sheets are aligned the same. Having adjustable guides or marking for smaller sheets would be nice
customer_reviews.author: Luno

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Hole Punch  -Useful product for organizing documents
customer_reviews.text: Swingline Desktop Hole Punch has helped me organize graphs, sales reports, presentations and other important documents in my office. It is smooth, easy to use and does precision punching. I can punch effortlessly with it. It is built to last, so I can hope it is going to serve me for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLa

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: As new homeschooling parents, this was a necessity. It's a solid brand and solid product. It punches three holes in paper, and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good quality puncher
customer_reviews.text: Nothing really bad to say about this device, punch holes, solid metal, check. Mine did not come with any extra punch head, but still not sure if normal or error on the description here.
customer_reviews.author: emc2

customer_reviews.title: not fragile
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Not too heavy or bulky. It does the job. No fear that it will break or not handle punching through several papers.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Swingline Desktop Hole Punch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust with a standard screwdriver (Flathead). The bottom cover is flimsy but the base is sturdy and will fit ten sheets. Now, to perforate ten sheets is hard with so short handle, you practically need to stand on it. A drawback is, it doesn't have an adjustable sheet guide. But it's still the best value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy build with a nice grip top for quick and easy use
customer_reviews.text: Solid build, does as it should. I like that it has solid weight to it. And the top of it has some grip so your hand doesn’t slide and mess up the alignment of the pages. Overall happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mia B

customer_reviews.title: Negative Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. I bought this product expecting for it to do one job, but it couldn’t even do that. Who makes a hole punch that can’t hole punch?? The construction is sloppy and flimsy. The middle hole punch has metal not properly melded; as a result, the entire whole punch can’t function. You had one job. Disappointed. I want to give this product negative stars for the fact that I couldn’t even punch one piece of paper. A failure of a product, simply put.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Choe

customer_reviews.title: Punches holes, but bottom falls off occasionally
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this product is that the bottom falls off. all of the loose hole punches fall out when you pick it up, but other than that it punches holes and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nache

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform well
customer_reviews.text: It does not do what it's supposed to. I tried punching a hole in one piece of paper, while this was on a flat surface. I pressed it all the way down and it does not make the holes complete. You end up having to tear them off. I tried 10-15 times with different papers and it made the same thing consistently. It performed ok with thicker papers which is understandable. However, I need it to work good with simple light papers as well.
customer_reviews.author: stigabre

customer_reviews.title: Really well made.
customer_reviews.text: I have had numerous 3 hole punches and this is one of the best made i have seen. I sent a previous model back because the individual hole punches were not adjustable. These are and allow me to move them as needed for different size paper and hole orientations.
customer_reviews.author: CConti

customer_reviews.title: Might be fine for some people
customer_reviews.text: Gave at 2 stars because there’s a guard on either side of the hole punch so, you can’t hole punch anything that isn’t a standard sheet of paper. Pretty annoyed
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Returned item.
customer_reviews.text: The item was missing a screw upon receipt and had been used. Punched paper fell out when I opened it so it was already used.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Lady 76

customer_reviews.title: 8.5x11 only
customer_reviews.text: This will only fit a sheet of 8.5x11 larger sheets will not fit. Even a sheet that was laminated so only a smidge longer was blocked by guides
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and will last for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same exact model in 2007 going into my freshman year of college and it’s held up and works great still. 11 years later, I bought this one to use at work and nothing about it seems any different (good or bad), and I’m still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Murch1jm

customer_reviews.title: Good Hole Punch
customer_reviews.text: Requires very little effort to punch 6-8 pages at a time. I have not tried more, but it seems to have good quality and the punched pieces are held securely until ready to dump.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use, and adjustable. I recommend it. I use it to punch holes in talks I give, so I can save them in a loose-leaf book.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Madley

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for a year...
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to have found this particular hole puncher. Seriously, all my roommates love it. I like to use plain white paper to write notes. I hole punch several sheets with this to get me school ready. It does the job i need it to do with great precision, all the pages come out uniform which i love. I haven't tried changing the levels but it seems easy enough. Clean up is a breeze! The bottom part slides out, have a trash can handy because sometimes the waste paper comes flying out. Happy Hole Punching!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S

customer_reviews.title: and this one is extremely sturdy and heavy duty which was exactly what i was ...
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new hole puncher, and this one is extremely sturdy and heavy duty which was exactly what i was looking for. I wanted one that was overall not too "bulky" or large and this Swingline one is the perfect option. The shipping was very fast and I have no problem hole punching a semi thick stack of papers. You don't need to press too hard, like some other hole punchers. The item is simplistic and well made. Definitely will be buying it again, (if i ever need another one).
customer_reviews.author: Tae Song

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing price and great quality. My son has binders for every class in school but not all homework or assignments are hole punched. We bought this to keep at home for him to be able to insert pages to his binders. Works great for such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: It works great ! No complaints ... but this is bulkier than expected. It is heavier and takes up more desk space.
customer_reviews.author: m. fung

customer_reviews.title: Can't line up the papers
customer_reviews.text: This works great and the quality is great, but there's no way to line up the papers before you hole-punch them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sturdy construction!
customer_reviews.text: I am in school and literally am hole-punching stuff every day. It feels very substantial and does not stick or get stuck on the way back up like other hole punchers I have had have done. I don't know if the last one I had was "ugly," but I really like the way this one looks. I would buy this again and at the price have thought about buying a second one. I will never need a second one so it makes no sense, but that is how much I like it. In the stores you would pay upwards of $15 for this. You can't even buy cheaply made ones in the stores at this price. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey_SC

customer_reviews.title: I like this hole punch! Very niiiice!
customer_reviews.text: After several years of minor use our cheapie three hole punch fell apart, leaving a mess of little paper circles all over my home office floor. I decided to get crazy and buy a good one. I know from watching Office Space that Swingline is a good brand of stapler. I assumed that translated into a quality hole punch and was not disappointed. This one is sturdy and punches thru multiple sheets of paper like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Vegoose

customer_reviews.title: It does the job...
customer_reviews.text: It’s exactly what I needed. It is very reasonably priced and does what I bought it for... it arrived very fast.
customer_reviews.author: PingMan

customer_reviews.title: Used item delivered...
customer_reviews.text: Overall works well but wasn’t aware I ordered a used product...it doesn’t say that anywhere in the description but when I opened the product box, a bunch of previously punched bits of paper fell out...
customer_reviews.author: Royce Crow

customer_reviews.title: Great quality; only works for letter-size sheets
customer_reviews.text: This is, overall, a solidly built, quality hole punch. It, well, punches holes in paper, as advertised. The sole drawback is that it is will not accommodate a sheet dimension larger than 11". I didn't anticipate this being an issue when I purchased the punch, but (Sherlock here) it turns out that laminated pages are slightly bigger than their unlaminated counterparts. Thus, I have had to send laminated pages off to the Great Hole Puncher in the Office, rendering the convenience of a home hole punch rather less convenient.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy and bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I’m going with three stars on this cause it was heavier than I expected. Works good though just like all swingline products I have putchased. So if weight isn’t an issue then consider this a five star review. Not recommended for a 12 year old backpack
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Kind of useful
customer_reviews.text: It is build tough and solid, but not perfect. You get what you pay for. It is pretty good for using rarely but not daily.
customer_reviews.author: Kanat M.

customer_reviews.title: Swingline Desktop Hole Puncher
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy excellent hole pucher, works as described and amazing value, three times cheaper than competition.
customer_reviews.author: Velo

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw - it will make a mess
customer_reviews.text: Major design flaw - if you move it or carry if around, the little paper circles come out of the top and get everywhere. I gave it away after a few uses because it was so irritating to have to vacuum after using it. I gave it two stars because it does at least do its job of successfully putting there holes in paper.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great home hole punch
customer_reviews.text: I'm homeschooling my five kiddos and needed a hole punch. At the store they were asking twice as much and for ones that did not appear to be this nice. This is as described and arrived quickly. I'm happy I found this and didn't just buy the one at the store. I would recommend this to anyone who needs an at home stapler. I don't think I would recommend for a business unless you don't need it often.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgett

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product. Good price
customer_reviews.text: The build of this is sturdy but the bottom plastic hole punch tray isnt and will sometimes drop the trash out. No other issuess to report. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid three hole punch
customer_reviews.text: Standard three hole punch. It requires a little more strength to push down than my old three hole punch, but not unreasonable. Doesn't seem like it's going to get jammed easily, which is great. I also like the bottom attachment, it slides off easily to clear out the paper scraps, rather than my old one which you had to pry off the bottom. The handle is rubber, which is nice to touch. All in all a nice, solid three hole punch.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

product_meta.title: Swingline Desktop Hole Punch, Hole Puncher, Precision Pro, Adjustable, 2-3 Holes, 10 Sheet Punch Capacity, Black/Silver (74037)
product_meta.description: The Precision Pro Hole Punch is the ultimate choice for precise punching. This durable metal punch boasts patented pin technology, ensuring that your punches are accurate and professional. 2-3 hole manual punch creates clean 9/32 holes with every press. A removable tray in the base allows for easy cleanup of punched holes. The punch comes with 1 extra punch head. Replacement punch heads (A7074870) are sold separately. backs this high-quality, black and silver punch with a limited 90-day warranty.
feature_bullets: PRECISION PUNCHING – Professional-grade, 2-3 hole metal punch is specially designed for accurate, manual hole punching. Trust this punch for perfectly professional precision.
PATENTED PINS – Professional punch uses precise, patented pin technology for consistently accurate performance.
10-SHEET CAPACITY – Punch creates clean and precise, 9/32" holes, piercing through up to 10 sheets of paper.
LESS MESS – Easy-glide chip tray makes cleanup of punched holes fast and simple. Removable tray built into the base of the punch.
REPLACEMENT PUNCH HEAD – Convenient punch comes with 1 extra punch head. Replacement punch heads (A7074870) are sold separately.
BUILT TO LAST – Swingline stands behind this high-quality black and silver punch with a limited 90-day warranty.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
